body: If you want the data sorted you could just use `std::set` instead of `std::unordered_set`. Just make a helper templatized over the set type. That's likely to be faster.
body_html: If you want the data sorted you could just use std::set instead of std::unordered_set. Just make a helper templatized over the set type. That's likely to be faster.
body_text: If you want the data sorted you could just use std::set instead of std::unordered_set. Just make a helper templatized over the set type. That's likely to be faster.
